item.description:

[quote=“Taylor John0, post:7, topic:124020”]Oh yes that DOES explain a lot.
But in the past, I knew I would f up like this.
So I had a copy of my client.java saved to my computer ^.^[/quote]

Good for you, see? Your learning, you one of maybe .01% that trys =].

item.title: What the hell?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“Taylor John0, post:5, topic:124020”]I just added the first } because it said this error:

'catch' without 'try' catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) { ^ [/quote]

There are 2 parts to that code, try and catch, your missing the try part of it.

item.title: What the hell?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {

Prevents your server from give a certain error code. If you don’t have a backup, I suggest you leanr how to code try and catches.

Read full topic

item.title: What the hell?
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

Ok something’s wrong with my server ><
I try to log in and it says unexpected response from server.
WTF!

Here’s what I fixed:

} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {

added first }
after adding

if(playerRights == 3){ //admin looks (edit it up) // Giving the player an unique look playerEquipment[playerHat] = 1149; playerEquipment[playerCape] = 3783; playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = 6585; playerEquipment[playerChest] = 6129; playerEquipment[playerShield] = 3122; playerEquipment[playerLegs] = 1079; playerEquipment[playerHands] = 2932; playerEquipment[playerFeet] = 2942; playerEquipment[playerRing] = 773; playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1; playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 4151;
